metadata.Title: CVE-2022-48303 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
GNU Tar through 1.34 has a one-byte out-of-bounds read that results in use of uninitialized memory for a conditional jump. Exploitation to change the flow of control has not been demonstrated. The issue occurs in from_header in list.c via a V7 archive in which mtime has approximately 11 whitespace characters.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48303` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tar - 1.29b-2ubuntu0.4
tar-scripts - 1.29b-2ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tar package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.29b-2ubuntu0.4').
